articles.title: Amber Davies Addresses Criticism Ahead of Strictly Come Dancing Final
articles.summary: As the Strictly Come Dancing final approaches, three remaining couples—Amber Davies with Nikita Kuzmin, George Clarke, and Karen Carney with Carlos Gu—are preparing for the last dance to win the glitterball trophy. The final marks the end of an era as presenters Tess Daly and Claudia Winkleman step down after this series. A key issue in the lead-up is the debate over Amber Davies' performing background, including roles in West End musicals and participation in Dancing on Ice, which some viewers argue gives her an unfair edge. At a press conference, Amber acknowledged her experience but emphasized that she has worked equally hard to reach the final, stating that love outweighs the hate. This controversy reflects a broader pattern on Strictly, where past contestants like Lewis Cope and JB Gill also faced scrutiny for prior performance experience. Meanwhile, Karen Carney, the first footballer to make the final, expressed pride and personal growth through the show. The grand final will air on BBC One and iPlayer, highlighting themes of hard work, public perception, and the value of overcoming challenges in entertainment competitions.

articles.title: Timothée Chalamet Collaborates with EsDeeKid to Debunk Alter-Ego Speculation
articles.summary: Timothée Chalamet, an Oscar-nominated actor, has addressed widespread rumors suggesting he is the anonymous rapper EsDeeKid by releasing a collaborative video. Speculation arose due to perceived similarities in their eyes, as EsDeeKid typically wears a mask revealing only his eyes. Chalamet initially responded with 'No comment' when questioned by the BBC, fueling further curiosity. To definitively quash the theories, he posted a video on social media featuring himself rapping alongside EsDeeKid on a remix of the track '4Raws'. In the video, Chalamet cleverly references the rumors by starting with only his eyes visible, mimicking EsDeeKid's style, before revealing his face and delivering lyrics that confirm his identity and mention his partner Kylie Jenner. Filmed at a north London convenience store, the clip was reposted by EsDeeKid and quickly went viral, with reactions from artists like Central Cee and Tinie Tempah. This collaboration also served as promotional content for Chalamet's new film, 'Marty Supreme', highlighting a savvy marketing strategy. The article notes that the idea of them being the same person was always unlikely, given differences such as EsDeeKid's Liverpudlian accent.

articles.title: Conflict Over Ben & Jerry's Independence Leads to Chair's Removal
articles.summary: Anuradha Mittal, who served as chair of Ben & Jerry's independent board for seven years, has accused Magnum, the company that now owns the brand, of threatening to launch a public smear campaign against her. According to Mittal, Magnum executives threatened to publish defamatory statements if she did not resign from her position. This accusation stems from an ongoing dispute regarding the independence of Ben & Jerry's board and its ability to pursue social missions without interference. Magnum responded by stating that Mittal no longer met the criteria to serve on the board, following an external investigation, and implemented new governance rules, including a nine-year term limit for board members. Additionally, two other board members are required to leave. The conflict has historical roots, as Ben & Jerry's was sold to Unilever in 2000 with provisions for an independent board, but tensions persisted over social issues like the brand's stance on Israeli-occupied territories. Recently, Unilever spun off its ice cream unit to form Magnum, which inherited these disputes. Mittal claims that for years, the board resisted efforts to muzzle its advocacy for human rights and peace, leading to the current stand-off and her removal.

articles.title: Rome Implements €2 Fee for Trevi Fountain Access to Manage Tourism
articles.summary: Starting February 1, 2026, tourists in Rome will be required to pay a €2 entrance fee to access the Trevi Fountain up close, as part of a new tariff system for certain monuments. The fee aims to generate €6.5 million annually for the city to fund upkeep and manage visitor flows, reducing chaos around the Baroque landmark. Mayor Roberto Gualtieri announced the move, emphasizing that the small charge will help control crowds, with the fountain currently attracting 30,000 daily visitors. Exemptions include children under five and individuals with disabilities, while residents gain free entry to other sites like the Sacred Area of Largo Argentina. Tourists can still view the fountain for free from a distance, and the city has implemented a queuing system capping access at 400 people at a time after recent restoration work. This policy reflects broader efforts to balance tourism revenue with preservation and local benefits.

articles.title: Wawrinka Announces Retirement Plans for 2026
articles.summary: Stan Wawrinka, a three-time Grand Slam champion from Switzerland, has declared that 2026 will mark the end of his professional tennis career. At 40 years old, Wawrinka reflected on his achievements, including victories over tennis legends Novak Djokovic and Rafael Nadal in major finals, such as the 2015 French Open and 2016 US Open. He described this decision as writing the 'final chapter' of his career, emphasizing his desire to push his limits and finish on a positive note. Wawrinka turned professional in 2002 and has accumulated 16 tour-level titles, along with an Olympic gold medal in doubles from the 2008 Beijing Games with Roger Federer. Despite recent injuries and a ranking outside the top 150, he remains motivated by dreams and the emotional connection with fans. His final season will commence at the United Cup in Perth in January 2026, as he looks forward to global farewell appearances. This announcement highlights the challenges and triumphs of a player who succeeded during the dominant 'Big Three' era in tennis.

articles.title: Kylie Minogue Achieves Christmas Chart Victory
articles.summary: Kylie Minogue has secured the Christmas number one spot in the UK charts this year with her single XMAS, ending Wham!'s reign with Last Christmas. The song, featured on an expanded edition of her 2015 album Kylie Christmas, was exclusively available on Amazon Music, giving it a promotional edge by being highlighted on Christmas playlists. This strategic move contributed to her success, alongside sales of limited edition vinyl and CD singles and plays on YouTube. Martin Talbot of the Official Charts Company noted that Kylie and her record label aggressively targeted this achievement, resulting in her biggest sales week in 23 years. The competition was intense, with only 10,000 copies separating the top five songs at one point, and contenders included Mariah Carey and Brenda Lee. This victory marks Kylie as the first female artist to top the charts across four different decades, a milestone in her long career that began with her first UK number one in 1988.
